app/gatewayStubConfigurations/Dockerfile (dockerfile)
=====================================================
Tests: 2 (SUCCESSES: 1, FAILURES: 1, EXCEPTIONS: 0)
Failures: 1 (LOW: 1)

LOW: Consider using 'COPY imposters /mb' command instead of 'ADD imposters /mb'
════════════════════════════════════════
You should use COPY instead of ADD unless you want to extract a tar file. Note that an ADD command will extract a tar file, which adds the risk of Zip-based vulnerabilities. Accordingly, it is advised to use a COPY command, which does not extract tar files.

See https://avd.aquasec.com/misconfig/ds005
────────────────────────────────────────
 app/gatewayStubConfigurations/Dockerfile:3
────────────────────────────────────────
   3 [ ADD imposters /mb
────────────────────────────────────────



app/package/helm/templates/deployment.yaml (helm)
=================================================
Tests: 55 (SUCCESSES: 45, FAILURES: 10, EXCEPTIONS: 0)
Failures: 10 (LOW: 10)

LOW: Container 'hip' of Deployment 'hip' should add 'ALL' to 'securityContext.capabilities.drop'
════════════════════════════════════════
The container should drop all default capabilities and add only those that are needed for its execution.

See https://avd.aquasec.com/misconfig/ksv003
────────────────────────────────────────
 app/package/helm/templates/deployment.yaml:30-41
────────────────────────────────────────
  30 ┌         - name: hip
  31 │           image: "bahmniindiadistro/hip:latest"
  32 │           ports:
  33 │             - containerPort: 8000
  34 │               protocol: TCP
  35 │           envFrom:
  36 │             - configMapRef:
  37 │                 name: hip-config
  38 └                 optional: false
  ..   
────────────────────────────────────────


LOW: Container 'hip' of Deployment 'hip' should set 'resources.limits.cpu'
════════════════════════════════════════
Enforcing CPU limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion.

See https://avd.aquasec.com/misconfig/ksv011
────────────────────────────────────────
 app/package/helm/templates/deployment.yaml:30-41
────────────────────────────────────────
  30 ┌         - name: hip
  31 │           image: "bahmniindiadistro/hip:latest"
  32 │           ports:
  33 │             - containerPort: 8000
  34 │               protocol: TCP
  35 │           envFrom:
  36 │             - configMapRef:
  37 │                 name: hip-config
  38 └                 optional: false
  ..   
────────────────────────────────────────


LOW: Container 'hip' of Deployment 'hip' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
════════════════════════════════════════
An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk.

See https://avd.aquasec.com/misconfig/ksv014
────────────────────────────────────────
 app/package/helm/templates/deployment.yaml:30-41
────────────────────────────────────────
  30 ┌         - name: hip
  31 │           image: "bahmniindiadistro/hip:latest"
  32 │           ports:
  33 │             - containerPort: 8000
  34 │               protocol: TCP
  35 │           envFrom:
  36 │             - configMapRef:
  37 │                 name: hip-config
  38 └                 optional: false
  ..   
────────────────────────────────────────


LOW: Container 'hip' of Deployment 'hip' should set 'resources.requests.cpu'
════════════════════════════════════════
When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention.

See https://avd.aquasec.com/misconfig/ksv015
────────────────────────────────────────
 app/package/helm/templates/deployment.yaml:30-41
────────────────────────────────────────

  37 │                 name: hip-config
  38 └                 optional: false
  ..   
────────────────────────────────────────


LOW: Container 'hip' of Deployment 'hip' should set 'resources.requests.memory'
════════════════════════════════════════
When containers have memory requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention.

See https://avd.aquasec.com/misconfig/ksv016

dev-Deployment-abdm-callback-proxy-2099166146.yaml (kubernetes)
===============================================================
Tests: 55 (SUCCESSES: 45, FAILURES: 10, EXCEPTIONS: 0)
Failures: 10 (LOW: 10)

LOW: Container 'abdm-callback-proxy' of Deployment 'abdm-callback-proxy' should add 'ALL' to 'securityContext.capabilities.drop'
════════════════════════════════════════
The container should drop all default capabilities and add only those that are needed for its execution.

See https://avd.aquasec.com/misconfig/ksv003
────────────────────────────────────────
 dev-Deployment-abdm-callback-proxy-2099166146.yaml:125-130
────────────────────────────────────────
 125 ┌                 - image: n0man/abdm-callback-proxy
 126 │                   imagePullPolicy: Always
 127 │                   name: abdm-callback-proxy
 128 │                   resources: {}
 129 │                   terminationMessagePath: /dev/termination-log
 130 └                   terminationMessagePolicy: File
────────────────────────────────────────


LOW: Container 'abdm-callback-proxy' of Deployment 'abdm-callback-proxy' should set 'resources.limits.cpu'
════════════════════════════════════════
Enforcing CPU limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion.

See https://avd.aquasec.com/misconfig/ksv011
────────────────────────────────────────
 dev-Deployment-abdm-callback-proxy-2099166146.yaml:125-130
────────────────────────────────────────

LOW: Container 'abdm-callback-proxy' of Deployment 'abdm-callback-proxy' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
════════════════════════════════════════
An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk.

See https://avd.aquasec.com/misconfig/ksv014

LOW: Container 'rabbitmq' of StatefulSet 'bahmni-dev-rabbitmq' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
════════════════════════════════════════
An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk.

See https://avd.aquasec.com/misconfig/ksv014
